title: The rise of boring architecture -- and the case for radically human buildings | Thomas Heatherwick
itunes:author: Thomas Heatherwick
description: Where did all the lumps and bumps on buildings go? When did city architecture become so ... dull? Here to talk about why cities need inspiring architecture, designer Thomas Heatherwick offers a path out of the doldrums of urban monotony -- and a vision of cities filled with soulful buildings that people cherish for centuries.
itunes:subtitle: The rise of boring architecture -- and the case for radically human buildings | Thomas Heatherwick
